dict.string: Let's use practice units to learn the battle basics.
1. Attacks and Panels
Break Panels to Build an Attack <font color="yellow">Tap</font> a panel to break it. nearby panels of the same color will connect and break.

A simple <font color="yellow">tap</font> on a panel is all it takes, <font color="red">No need to trace your finger over each panel.</font> <font color="yellow">Tap</font> again to break another panel.
After 3 taps, you'll attack the enemy. Try <font color="yellow">tapping</font> on <font color="yellow">2 more panels</font>. Any color will do. Whatever strikes your fancy.
Let's Review: <font color="yellow">Tap</font> any panel to break it. You'll attack the enemy after <font color="yellow">3 taps</yellow>. Break panels of any color. Break more panels for more damage.
Continue attacking to defeat this enemy.
2. Crash Panels
Connect 6 or more panels to make a <font color="yellow">Crash Panel</font> appear. Start by getting rid of any panels in the way.
Break a <font color="yellow">Crash Panel</font> to activate a <font color="yellow">Crash Skill</font>. Let's try it now, shall we?

Connect 12 or more panels to make a <font color="yellow">Special Crash Panel</font> or <font color="yellow">SC Panel</font>. Breaking an SC Panel creates a panel-busting bomb. Break several SC Panels for a chain reaction.
Let's Review: Connect 6 or more panels for a Crash Panel, 12 or more for a SC Panel. Connect as many as you can.
Continue attacking to defeat this enemy.
3. Battle Turns
Each time you attack, the enemy's count goes down by 1. When the enemy's count reaches 0, the enemy will attack. Try breaking a panel to attack.
You'll take turns attacking. Remember, the enemy attacks when their counter reaches 0.
4. Tap Hearts, Recover HP
The enemy attacked and you lost HP. Break <font color="yellow">Heart Panels</font> to recover HP. If your HP reaches 0 it's game over.
Let's Review: Break <font color="yellow">Hearts</font> to recover HP. The more you break, the bigger the effect.
Now, let's finish off this fight.
Battles are turn-based. Beware of attacks when enemy count reaches 0!
Basic 4. Break Hearts to Recover

Your HP has reduced with the enemy's attack. Game Over when HP reaches 0!
<font color="yellow">Break Hearts</font>and recover!

Review
<font color="yellow">Break Hearts</font> to recover HP! Break more for a higher effect!!
Basic 5. Skills

Units each have their own skills. When units get a '<font color="yellow">SKILL OK</font>' icon, it's a chance to use their Skill!
Try tapping it.
Now, play freely to defeat the enemy!
5. Unit and Enemy Attributes
Units have different attributes. You can tell a unit's attribute by the color of their icon frame. This unit's attribute is <font color="red">Red</font>.
Breaking panels of the same color as a unit increases an attack's power. Keep this in mind when breaking panels.
You can tell an enemy's attribute by the icon on its HP gauge.
Attributes have a strength and weakness. Choose units with the advantage to deal more damage. Weaker units deal less damage.
Tap on this enemy to target it.
Now you can attack this <font color="green">Green</font> enemy as a priority.
Try attacking with a <font color="red">Red</font> unit.
The attack was effective, so you dealt more damage. Remember: you'll do less damage if you choose the wrong attribute. Choose carefully.

Let's Review: Exploit the enemy attribute's weakness for more damage. Use <font color="red">Red</font> against <font color="green">Green</font>, <font color="green">Green</font> against <font color="yellow">Yellow</font>, <font color="yellow">Yellow</font> against <font color="blue">Blue</font>, and <font color="blue">Blue</font> against <font color="red">Red</font>
Remember: pay close attention to attributes during battle.
Basic 5. Skills
Each unit has a unit skill. If their <font color="yellow">Skill OK</font> icon starts flashing, their skill is ready. Tap the unit to unleash a skill.
Let's Review: Each unit has its own skill. Oh, and by the way, Units can use their skills after a set number of turns.
Final: Fever
When the Fever Gauge is full, you can unleash <font color="yellow">Fever</font>! Tap the Fever button to activate <font color="yellow">Fever Time</font>!
Let's Review: Break lots of panels at once to fill your Fever Gauge quickly. use Fever for a <font color="yellow">feverish</font> attack.
Nice job! That's it for battle practice.
Try multiplayer for more excitement. Work together with friends to defeat the invading avatars!
When your HP is running low, break Heart Panels to recover HP.
Let's use practice units to learn the battle basics.
1. Attacks and Panels
Break Panels to Build an Attack <font color="yellow">Tap</font> a panel to break it. nearby panels of the same color will connect and break.

A simple <font color="yellow">tap</font> on a panel is all it takes, <font color="red">No need to trace your finger over each panel.</font> <font color="yellow">Tap</font> again to break another panel.
After 3 taps, you'll attack the enemy. Try <font color="yellow">tapping</font> on <font color="yellow">2 more panels</font>. Any color will do. Whatever strikes your fancy.
Let's Review: <font color="yellow">Tap</font> any panel to break it. You'll attack the enemy after <font color="yellow">3 taps</yellow>. Break panels of any color. Break more panels for more damage.
Continue attacking to defeat this enemy.
2. Crash Panels
Connect 6 or more panels to make a <font color="yellow">Crash Panel</font> appear. Start by getting rid of any panels in the way.
Break a <font color="yellow">Crash Panel</font> to activate a <font color="yellow">Crash Skill</font>. Let's try it now, shall we?

Connect 12 or more panels to make a <font color="yellow">Special Crash Panel</font> or <font color="yellow">SC Panel</font>. Breaking an SC Panel creates a panel-busting bomb. Break several SC Panels for a chain reaction.
Let's Review: Connect 6 or more panels for a Crash Panel, 12 or more for a SC Panel. Connect as many as you can.
Continue attacking to defeat this enemy.
3. Battle Turns
Each time you attack, the enemy's count goes down by 1. When the enemy's count reaches 0, the enemy will attack. Try breaking a panel to attack.
You'll take turns attacking. Remember, the enemy attacks when their counter reaches 0.
4. Tap Hearts, Recover HP
The enemy attacked and you lost HP. Break <font color="yellow">Heart Panels</font> to recover HP. If your HP reaches 0 it's game over.

Let's Review
<font color="yellow">Tap Hearts</font> to recover HP.
5. Skills
Each unit has a unit skill. If their <font color="yellow">SKILL OK</font> icon starts flashing, their skill is ready. Tap the unit to unleash a skill.
Let's Review: Each unit has its own skill. Oh, and by the way, Units can use their skills after a set number of turns.
Final: Fever
When the Fever Gauge is full, you can unleash <font color="yellow">Fever</font>! Tap the Fever button to activate <font color="yellow">Fever Time</font>!
Let's Review: Break lots of panels at once to fill your Fever Gauge quickly. use Fever for a <font color="yellow">feverish</font> attack.
Congratulations! You've got the basics.
Don't forget to try Multiplayer for even more excitement.
When your HP is running low, break Heart Panels to recover HP.

Next, remove this panel.
Review: <font color="yellow">Tap</font> any panel to break it. You'll attack the enemy after <font color="yellow">3 taps</yellow>. Break panels of any color. Break more panels for more damage.
COUNT lets you know how many panels you removed. More panels yields a stronger attack.
Longer chains yield stronger Crash Panels or CP

Crash Skill activated
Press and hold a unit icon for details about a unit's skills.

Special Crash Panels or SCP will become Bombs.
Bombs will destroy surrounding panels.
Connect 6 or more panels for a Crash Panel, 12 or more for a SCP. Connect as many as you can.

Panel Affinity If panel of <font color="red">same </font>attribute color as front unit removed- <font color="red">2 counts</font> If removed panel color is <font color="blue">weaker </font>than front unit's color- <font color="blue">0.5 counts</font>
